summary: hg cope with metachanges permission changes
description: in hgfelog.py the metachange detection is too simplistic a duplicate modification on a second branch shows up as a metachange because the file rev on the other branch is hgsubversion and hgconvert both produce commits from svn merges that have filerevs whose linkrev is not the current commit
in fisheye we create a new revision but it's parent rev is the last content change revsions parent instead of the last content change revision because that's what mercurial stores in it's filectx
we'd have to detect that and cope with it
in fe a subsequent content mod will also have as it's parent the previous content mod revision instead of the perm change revision again because that's what mercurial stores

summary: need to add visibility query when negations are used
description: when you have a lucene query such as bq
or bq
nonemptyfieldids:version you need to supplement it with the visibility query on the field like this bq
nonemptyfieldids:version visiblefieldids:version when the field version is not visible and in scope of an issue it will not be indexed

this means that positive queries like correctly skip the issue in question despite the however a negative query like will return those issues which do not have version indexed which is not what we want when we turn off indexing of a field for a particular issue
for a more concrete example see so to counteract this we need to supplement these queries with the visibility query so that we exclude the issues as well as the ones which have a specific value
the same goes for nonemptyfieldids:version when version is not indexed it does not appear in the list of non empty field ids regardless of

summary: resolved field on remoteissue breaks backwards compatibility
description: we added a new field resolved to the remoteissue in jira which breaks backwards compatibility however we're currently debating if we should not do this
the options are basically this don't break backwards compatibility and leave remoteissue as is

if a client wants to get the resolution date they'll have to make a separate soap call which sucks from a performance point of view introduce a of the soap interface which will basically be a copy of but will also have things like the resolution date added
clients can choose to use the old interface for backwards compatibility or upgrade to the new interface

this sucks from a maintenance point of view for us though since a lot of code will be duplicated in the rpc plugin we go with what we have now basically breaking backwards compatibility and forcing all our clients to their soap client stubs
also we'll have to add this field to jelly as well

summary: xml import from jira to failing on windows
description: while trying to upgrade from to an error was thrown while importing the xml backup and the system administration privilege would not be assigned to the jira-administrators group
the problem seems to be specific to the customer data and only when restoring on windows when the index directory from the backup cannot be created on the target machine
i can repeatedly reproduce the problem with the customer's backup
i've attempted to replicate myself by installing creating issues integrating fisheye then exporting to jira without success
it looks like dataimport.java refreshes each of the plugins when the restore process is started
when the fisheye plugin would get reloaded it would try to run a reindex on the old index directory and throw an exception when the location of the old index directory cannot be created

this throws an exception and the import fails because its not caught in the jira looks like this is might be fixed in the trunk by surrounding the code with block around the refresh of the plugins and activating the new index directory in a finally block

summary: the level cache can be over eager and grant incorrect security levels to users
description: the issuesecuritylevelmanager finds the list of security levels available to a user for a given project or issue
the problem is that we cache the results against the project even if it was a query for an issue and also we use the list cached against the project even if it is an issue query

this leads to incorrect results when the issue level security scheme includes permissions like reporter or assignee please see testpromptuserforsecuritylevelonmove.testmoveproject_issue_securitylevelnotavailabletouser for a func test that was failing because of this bug
note however that this test was not written specifically or this particular issue so it may randomly pass
bug exists in issuelevelsecurities.getuserssecuritylevels

summary: user will have login problem with rememberme cookie when there is a racing condition
description: given a user logs in before but for some reason the session times out

the user is using which has previews to the website when opening a new tab when the user try to open a new tab in chrome and quickly type the fisheye home address and hit enter expected the user should have no problem logging in because there is a remember me cookie set already from the last login
actual the user is forced to log in again
possible cause the preview feature from chrome's new tab page tries to load a thumbnail from fisheye which trigger a request to fisheye with the remember me cookie
this request comes along with the user's request and they cause a racing condition
if the chrome's request comes first the backend will generate a new rnd number for the remember me cookie
however the user's real request comes to the backend with the old cookie number
that will result in a mismatch
extra notes the problem may not only happens in chrome but in any situation where there are two requests triggered simultaneously after session timeout or expired

summary: crowdservice#authenticate should throw a subclass of failedauthenticationexception
description: introduce a new exception called accountnotfoundexception that is a subclass of failedauthenticationexception when the user cannot be found in crowdservice#authenticate will no longer throw the runtime usernotfoundexception
the reason for this change is that before crowd when a user is not found a failedauthenticationexception which is a checked exception would be thrown which is the correct behaviour
since crowd however we throw a usernotfoundexception

the reason for this change is actually due to the fact that we want applicationservice#authenticate to throw a usernotfoundexception so that we can ignore it and attempt authentication with other directories
we don't want to stop an authentication just because a directory does not contain the user
the problem with throwing a usernotfoundexception is that every client code calling crowdservice#authenticate will need to now also catch a usernotfoundexception when they generally don't care
the above solution allows client code which cares about distinguishing the types of failedauthenticationexception to do so which keeping client code minimal

summary: queries with in clauses not cached properly
description: for queries with an in clause we use hqlbatchedinclausehelper that splits the query into a number of queries where each subquery's in clause is limited to a number of items by default to better support certain dbmses which have trouble with large in clauses
the subqueries generated by hqlbatchedinclausehelper are then iterated which can be problematic if the base query is expected to be cached
the iterated queries don't go through hibernate's query cache potentially causing them to be executed a bunch of times
this affects a few areas of the application notably checking project permissions

summary: seraph needs to support the rest authentication spec
description: the canonical version is at and you should really read that in case this changes
but at the moment it reads if the parameter is specified its value will determine which type will be required for this request
possible values are basic cookie any if its value is basic valid http basic credentials will be required in the http header
if none present the application must return an http response with the status code of authentication required

if the credentials are present but invalid the application must return an http response with the status code of containing a status and a subcode of if its value is cookie a valid session cookie will be required in the http header

if none is present the application must return an http response with the status code of with an http header on the response www-authenticate cookie if the cookie are present but invalid the application must return an http response with the status code of containing a status and a subcode of if its value is any either a session cookie or basic authentication credentials may be present
if none present the application allows the request to continue as an anonymous request

however if the cookie are present but invalid or if the http basic credentials are present but invalid the application must return an http response with the status code of containing a status and a subcode of all requests with beginning with rest must be treated as if the query parameter was set to without set if invalid http basic credentials or an invalid cookie is present but invalid the request will continue without the user logged in

summary: to save time and db thrashing switching to board should select a child version by default not a parent version
description: currently when you go into greenhopper and have not yet selected a version to display in the task board or chart board greenhopper defaults to the entry in the version list

this takes an extremely long time to display if you are using child and parent versions because the item on the list is a parent version which has tons of issues yet of the time what you want to view is the child version which corresponds to your sprint and only focus in on the work being done now or soon
so this request is for greenhopper to display the lowest child version by default and not the item in the version list
if the customer is not using child versions then of course the lowest child version will still be the item in the list

but in our case where we have sprints under a version master version and when gh selects version which causes gh to try to display graphs task boards or planning pages with nearly a thousand jira issues

yuck even better it would be great if the planning board would default to unscheduled if a version has not already been selected after all planning is about focusing on the work to come not the work in process or work in the past

summary: lexorank rebalance causes amplifications on lucene in jira datacenter
description: summary in jira datacenter lexorank rebalance causes amplifications on lucene which may cause performance degradation if cluster have capacity

environment jira datacenter large number of issues large number of custom fields steps to reproduce setup jira datacenter trigger or wait for lexorank rebalance expected results jira datacenter performance will be not affected and no replication lag actual results jira datacenter performance could be affected and there will be replication lag
that will cause data discrepancy between nodes

you will have following error notes problem is caused by set of conditions/problems lexorank rebalancing requires rebalancing of all records in rank field in case of jdc that required reindexing of all issues with all related customfields/comments that causes read and write amplification as all nodes needs to update their lucene index for all issues jdc uses same replicatedindexoperation mechanism for all updates
that means that critical replication updates from at other nodes initiated by user action compete with lexorank updates
workarounds reduce the number of nodes in the cluster
testing reveals diminishing returns in performance in clusters larger than nodes
avoid closing a sprint with issues in an unresolved status
this requires a new rank value for all these issues and can trigger a lexorank rebalance
if you are planning to import hundreds of issues delay this until you have tested and resolved performance bottlenecks
a rank must be generated for every issue and this can trigger a lexorank rebalance
leave only one node in lb to prevent serving stale data from other nodes
this negates the high availability value of data center so is considered a last resort
this also requires that each node is capable of handling the full concurrent user traffic for your organization as is the best practice for an ha cluster

full details on workarounds and solutions are available at software data center lexorank indexing lag note on fix problem mitigation we have worked on reducing the need of lexorank balancing being triggered also a number of improvements to lexorank balancing has been implemented that reduce impact of it running on jira cluster
we have addressed replication lag in that said a running lexorank balancing will still cause some read and write amplification
more details about resolution are available at software data center lexorank indexing lag

summary: not moved with parent issues to other projects
description: when moving an issue with to a different project if that project is associated with an issue security scheme issch the will not be moved
the consequence is the parent issue belongs to the new project while its still belong to the original project

there are several possible variants if the original project is not associated with an issch or associated with a different issch different sets of security levels if no security level is set for the parent issue in the new project the will still be accessible viewable if a security level is set for the parent issue in the new project the will be no longer accessible if the original project is associated with the same issch as the destination project the will be accessible and inherit the parent issue's security level but still belong to the original project expected behavior as inherit their parent's security level they should be moved with the parent to whichever projects while still inheriting the parent's security level if

summary: advanced navigator view drops invalid url parameters
description: it is possible to pass both jql and old url parameters into the advanced navigator view
at the moment the url parameters are ignored
we need to make the advanced navigator accept the old parameters correctly
the current things that are currently broken at least the url parameters seem to be ignored by the advanced view even when valid
internally the query with the url parameters and jql is created however it is lost somewhere
the url parameters will only be read in when the parameter is added to the url
the searchinputtransformers.getsearchclause will return null for invalid url parameters
this means that invalid url parameters are silently dropped from the generated query
we need them to return the invalid clause so the regular jql error handling will work

summary: navigator context calcuation does not work correctly when dealing with jql parameters and parameters
description: the issue navigator used to have code that obtained the searchcontext for new searches using the pid and type url parameters
with the introduction of the jql the searchconext needs to come from pid type and the jql
the main problem here is that to generate the searchcontext we need the complete query but to correctly generate the query we need the searchcontext
this is why the old jira code used to get a stupid searchcontext off the url parameters
we can solve this in at lest the following ways use the jqlquery pid and type parameters to generate a stupid searchcontext before we construct the query
if we hit a query that is too complex then we can just jump straight over to advanced navigator create a clause without validation initially then validate after you get the whole query

this will probably require changes to issue navigator but may be cleaner but will also require us to ensure that the searchinputtransformer.getsearchclause and searchinputtransformer.populatefromquery round trip correctly with invalid parameters and input
in particular i know that the getsearchclause method do not currently work with invalid parameters they just drop them
in any case we need to think about how doesitfit tm works with this again
if validation fails should we do a doesitfit calculation and move off onto advanced or should we stay in the simple navigator and display the validation errors
i guess this really depends on whether or no the doesitfit works with invalid queries pretty sure that it does

summary: relational date clause query factory throws indexoutofboundsexception on bad operand when creating query not through issuenavigator
description: if you run a search request view xml view with the clause created qwerty an indexoutofboundsexception is thrown back to the user
this is because the daterelationalqueryfactory assumes that the list of values that come back from the operands contains element
so to fix this check that the list returned is not null and has exactly one element otherwise the false result should be returned

when fixing this factory please check other factories for similar bugs a few of the factories use a similar this should be when doing the search request urls so be sure to remember invalid inputs for every single clause as test cases
note estimate does not include the func test just described

summary: text jql fields do not handle multiple queryliteral objects
description: the text fields do not handle multiple queryliteral values being returned
it is possible for an operand to return multiple values and not be a list
we should handle this like any other field
for example summary c should be translated into summary a or summary c like anything else
at the moment we simply ignore anything but the queryliteral and log a useless message

summary: create search request factory method that also validates inputs dont silently drop invalid params in searchrequesturlhandler
description: the searchrequestfactory rewritten in is used in places issuenavigator jelly and searchrequesturlhandler
issuenavigator handles its own validation of parameters so it is free to call the create method on the factory knowing that it will not perform any validation

the urlhandler however does not perform any validation on parameters it does validate but instead of throwing an exception when trying to create a searchrequest with invalid parameters it silently drops them in some cases i have not checked all for example access an xml view with a temporary search request the parameter contains an invalid value but the datesearchinputtransformer#getsearchclause method treats this the same as if the parameter was not specified

thus the xml view will actually return all issues since no other parameters or jql were this is not ideal we should be returning a code response to the client telling them that their input was invalid

the suggested way to do this there might be others is to create another method on the searchrequestfactory interface that returns a result object which can contain the error messages produced when trying to create the search request from the invalid parameters
this would then be called instead of the old create method and the urlhandler could properly report back the errors to the client

summary: issuepicker ajax queries can use excessive memory
description: when searching for issues in the issue picker if someone enters a prefix that matches a lot many thousands of issue keys this gets expanded by lucene into a query with thousands of terms
as this search is unsorted it then tries to score it creating a scorer per term
these scorers take up a lot memory we saw for issues and are completely unnecessary as we will only ever match one issue key in the issue key field
we need to implement a constantscoreprefixquery similar in design to lucene's

summary: handle lucene queries that have too many clauses in such a way that the user can be notified about it
description: we have a potential problem with searching for comments in jql now because the way we do it is run the comment search over the comment index collect the issue ids for the matching documents build up an issue query that will match any of the collected ids and then run it over the issue index
if the comment query is too generic comment awordthatwontexist we are likely to get many matching issue ids on a large instance of jira which then translates to a large query for the issue index
at the moment we have the maximum number of terms a query can contain set to but on an instance with more than this number of issues a query with that many terms could be a occurrence

then on top of the number of issues there are other factors which can influence the number of terms used namely how complex the permissions filter for that user is which is a function of how many projects how many issue security schemes how many groups the user is a member of what actually happens is when a booleanquery is being constructed and exceeds the maximum number of terms a runtime exception is thrown this is not currently trapped anywhere in jira code

we suspect that this might happen a bit more often now with irresponsible use of the comment search but in reality this could also occur due to say a jql function that generates too many terms to search for
ideally we want a way to report back to the user how this happened so that they can modify their query
it would be best to handle this in a standard preferably single way across all clausequeryfactorys
however this only monitors the queries generated for each specific terminal clause so we would also need handling when the clauses are combined

but by that stage lost the insight into which clause caused the problem or contributed most to the excess of we have a similar problem when after combining all the queries we then add on the permissions filter for the user

summary: searching relationally on issue ids should be allowed
description: when the issue clause was being implemented a decision was made to allow relational clauses on issue keys only and not for issue ids
i have discovered an edge case which highlights the need for relational clauses with issue ids

if you have a clause which is like so issue and you save this in a filter and share it with users who cannot see the hsp project when they run the filter they will see this jql query issue where is the issue id of this is due to sanitisation of issue clauses
this will return no results as expected since they cannot see the project
however if they go to edit the query they will be presented with these error messages issue could not be found for field the field issue does not support the relational operator for issue ids
the first is valid but the second i think would be confusing for the user
so we should allow relational searching on issue ids too
my suggestion to keep the results consistent is to lookup the issue key of the issue with the id and then generate the same query as if the key were used

summary: soap and jelly progress workflow calls do not take into account exisiting issue values
description: if soap or the transitionworkflow jelly tag is use to progress and issue through a workflow step then the existing issue values can be ignored n the process
this is related to and which are attempts to make resolution field act like it does on the web page
this issue is a placeholder for the work needed to fix this and more importantly test it up the wazoo
in a nutshell the soap and jellt tags need to populate the fieldholdervalues map before calling workflowtransitionutil

however the big guy is afraid that the objects a custom field places into the fhv on populatefromissue may not be the same objects that are placed into the fhv via populatefromparams and hence this could lead to class cast exceptions and the like
we need to dylans change with the populatefromissue call and then a bucket load of testing on all the field and all the customfield types to prove that no problems will arise in the possible mismatch

summary: fix header injection vulnerabilities
description: a number of vulnerabilities were found during which expose jira to header injection attacks note that different application server configurations may expose or hide the presence of a header injection vulnerability
standalone tomcat is usually not vulnerable
tomcat redirects all of the above to setheader which is implemented in the coyote http connector such that bytes in header values are translated to spaces
this is not specified behaviour but avoids header injection when using that connector
tomcat apache httpd with configured and over https is known to not perform the coyote header value translation making it entirely vulnerable to header injection
jetty in a simple embedded deployment with the default http connector url encodes values in setcookie values but opens setcontenttype and sendredirect to header injection
suspect classes viewthumbnailservlet most likely has a hole
if an image attachment contains a filename with the characters when the thumbnail is viewed this filename will be supplied raw as part of the content-disposition header
the corresponding code in viewattachment url encodes the value
trustedapplicationsfilter could be a possible header injection site since the data from the request headers is routed to the response headers
this relies on there being some way to encode the header separator into the request header
no such encoding mechanism has been found
bugzillasearch.jsp is vulnerable the id parameter is used in a header it is also involved in an xss bug raised jirawebactionsupport returnurl support seems to be vulnerable
if this is correct then this is a similar bug to

summary: attachment lost with parallel bulk moves
description: steps to reproduce the problem create an issue in project a and add an attachment bulk move that issue to project b but wait before confirming the bulk move
in a second browser log in with the same user bulk move the same issue to project b and confirm the operation
you can see that the issue is moved it got assigned a new issue id in the new project and the attachment is moved to the correct path
confirm the bulk move in the first browser
you get an error saying the logs will report the second bulk move partially succeeds
a new issue id is given in the new project and the change history is reflected accordingly
however the file attachment is lost
it is likely that this situation would be reproducible by clicking the back button on the browser while bulk moving if there were many issues on the bulk move
the first bulk move operation did move the attachment from the old project to the new one
the second bulk move still tries to move the attachment from the old location and fails
at the very least the bulkmoveoperation.moveattachments function should check whether the renameto function succeeds or fails and log an error message if failure
ideally this situation would be prevented all together and either the move of that issue would fail or the attachment would be moved successfully

summary: message type attachments get lost when creating issues from emails
description: when configuring jira to create issues based on incoming emails if an email contains an attachment that is itself an email usually with eml extension and this attachment will be dropped and not attached to the resultant issue

here is an example of headers possibly encountered this was done because in some mail clients when a user replies to a message thread the mail client can be set to include the previously sent from that thread as an attachment
so to avoid attaching unnecessary messages to jira issues these attachments are dropped
however this hinders the other main use case that is when users are forwarding an arbitrary email as an attachment as part of a new email which is to be picked up by jira
there are also reported problems when doing similar attaching using thunderbird

under certain situations thunderbird will set the content type of the attached message to if the attached message happens to have a long name such that the name is split up over multiple header lines as dictated by rfc this will cause the attached message to be dropped
here is an example of possible headers this is due to javamail not being able to parse the filename correctly jira will not attach an attachment with a null

summary: suboptimal performance for lucene queries within jira instances with a large number of projects and issue security levels
description: user symptoms generally lucene searches taking upwards of seconds each time

examples calculating aggregate time tracking information for a set of issues takes a long time lazy loading portlets saved filters portlet takes a long time to display the counts of issues in each filter note that the performance issues are more problematic for users with more permissions in the jira instance
that is an administrator with full access to every project and issue security level with suffer a greater performance hit than a user with more restricted permissions for the same query

technical information in lucene a cachingwrapperfilter can be used to wrap another filter so that the resulting bitset which is used to filter out matching results from a search is cached because this bitset can be expensive to create when there are a lot of terms in the underlying query
in jira there is a bug that means that the cachingwrapperfilter for each searchrequest and user is never cached meaning that every time it is used the bitset needs to be reconstructed

if this is remedied there will be a significant speed increase to lucene queries in jira instances with a large number of projects issue security levels as this filter is used extensively throughout the lucene subsystem

description: if there is a slow network connection between web browser and the box running jira and if the jira instance has many projects of the order of or more and if the user has the projects portlet on their dashboard then the dashboard does not display in internet explorer and it works fine in firefox
the browser internet explorer renders the header the logo and the home browse projects find issues create new issue but then not the rest of the dashboard page
the browser appears to try to reload the page a few times
this is apparent because the page briefly flashes and the waiting for url text at the bottom of the browser seems to redisplay
sometimes there is first a website found
waiting for reply
message briefly displayed in the message window at the bottom of the browser

the browser tries this several times sometimes for seconds or so sometimes for several minutes before finally giving up displaying a popup window saying internet explorer cannot open the internet site operation aborted
this behaviour is readily reproducible using a local import of and using tcpmon to simulate a slow network connection

use the following delay settings in tcpmon bytes per pause delay in milliseconds the behaviour is also readily observable on if you add the projects portlet to your dashboard or create a new dashboard page containing the projects the problem was previously reported by two separate support customers
in their cases it only appears on slow links
the behaviour is not observable on the local import of if you do not use the delay

it is interesting to note that at the times when the browser seems to be trying to reload the page the shell running tcpmon displays the following error microsoft has a bug report for the above error message however that bug relates to javascript specifically to when a child container html element contains script code that tries to modify the parent container element of the child container
it is unlikely that this bug is the cause of our error as you can turn off javascript in ie and comment out all javascript and links to javascript files in the served page and the error still occurs
we tried saving the static page back on the server do a view source in firefox after the page is successfully displayed then save it back to the server and then accessing it
same error occurs
we tried another page that is about the same size and it displays correctly
so the error is content specific
perhaps it is related to nested tables we spent significant time trying to find the root cause and have been unable to
as there are straightforward workarounds we will not spend any more time on it at this stage
the workarounds are either use the projects portlet in the dashboard if you have lots of projects
if you want links to projects on your dashboard consider using the project table portlet instead
use firefox instead of internet explorer

summary: permission denied when viewing issue moved from project with security scheme to project with none
description: in one of our projects sft just implemented a security scheme
now when we move issues from that project to another vdb without a security scheme they can no longer be viewed or edited by anyone
instead an error message stating permission denied occurs
verified this is occurring by looking at the database directly

looking at the record in the jiraissue table for one of the problem issues observed that the security field remains set after the move even though the security scheme referenced is not applicable for the new project vdb
now if i directly make the field null for the issue in the database as it would be if the issue was created directly for that project the issue magically appears
obviously issues effectively disappearing is very bad
the only workaround that i can think of is to apply the security scheme to all projects as issues may be moved between various projects
in terms of implementation it seems like there would be two ways to solve this
once would be to clear the security field as part of the move
the other would be to ignore the security field if the project that the issue is associated with has no security scheme
the second approach appears more favorable as it means that if you move the issue back to the original project then the probably appropriate security level is maintained
also convinced that the above is happening due to something i noticed when i initially applied the security scheme
i accidentally canceled the operation and was left with half the issues in the project inaccessible
from what i could tell this was because the security field had been set for those issues but the security scheme had not been set for the project
presumably this done after all the issues have been updated in that case the fix was just to run through the operation again but a bit of a trap so might also want to be addressed
regards simon

summary: automated jira backup failes without proper warning
description: i have reported this to support michelle de guzman and was told to report it as a bug

when jira server is setup with a scheduled backup to xml and there is some problem with the contents of a field in the database the backup may fail leaving behing a partial zip file giving the impression that the backup completed without problems
this happend to me where one of the date fields in the database contained the value the backup job would dump the tables up to the point where it read this record and then fail
however the backup job created a zip file anyway giving the impression that the backup was complete
i was able to track down the problem by doing a manual database export using the gui
it generated an error message and by looking at the xml file i was able to track down the problem to the table and record
i think that the scheduled backup should produce some warning when the job fails and most importantly should not create a resulting output file giving the impression that the job completed
thanks

summary: everybody can change another users username so the user can't login
description: go to the login page click forgot password enter an existing username in uppercase click send it to me a username is normally in lowercase but by entering the username in uppercase and saying that you have forgot the password a new password is generated like normally and send to the users email but one other crucial thing also happens the username is now also changed to uppercase
when the unaware user gets the and try to login with the new auto generated password the user is told that sorry your username and password are incorrect please try again
this is because he is now trying to login with a lowercase username
if the user is smart he will see that the mail with the new password also lists his username and that this is in uppercase
if he then tries to login with his username in uppercase and the new password he is shown this message you do not have the permissions required to browse any projects
just like in the only solution for the user now is to do like the hacker and request a new password just this time by writing his username in now his username is changed back to lowercase
when he now tries to login with his new password and his lowercase username it works fine

an interesting side effect is that now it is not possible to login with an uppercase username anymore like in it is still possible though to change the username back to uppercase again with the method described above
btw this bug is close related to is in tern close related to which is a duplicate
the two bugs and has maybe also some relevance but not as much as and is duplicate

description: summary perforce repository indexing fails when the file path including the filename contains a non unicode character

environment perforce is configured as non unicode steps to reproduce expected results the indexing works and the files are available in fisheye actual results the below exception is thrown in the file workaround the following alternative are available as a workaround preferred convert the repository to a unicode one in perforce

add the property to the jvm system properties see jvm system properties atlassian documentation and environment variable this can be achieved in the following way add the following to the file add the following to the environment variable solution fisheye allows you to define encoding for perforce repository
before fisheye this encoding was used only to process perforce output
in fisheye and later also input commands are constructed with encoding that is readable by perforce
to make sure that the fisheye input is readable for the perforce repository encoding has to be set according to the file paths encoding in the repository
for example if a committer uses windows machine with western europe character set as their default encoding the same encoding must be set in fisheye

summary: blame calculation problem changelist description or diff can contain diff metadata perforce rcs
description: rcs diff parsing can fail if changelist description or added lines contain text that we interpret as rcs metadata change by author possible fix could be skipping n lines after an add marker
however this approach fails when requesting more than one changelist diff in one batch and one of them does not finish with a new line
then we can get the following output we distinguish if change is a start of a new changelist or just a plain text of the added line

currently we treat it as a new changelist see possible solution is to switch to but that of course requires testing the new diff format and making sure all supported perforce servers are capable of providing diffs in this problem appears for example when parsing file there is a test that currently fails com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.describeprocessortest#testdescribediffsthatcontaindiffliketext

summary: blame scm fallback should persist the fetched blame
description: in some cases requests to get blame will call out to the scm to retrieve it
this happen if storing blame is disabled globally via the system property or for svn if the changeset is not completely indexed yet

the fetched blame is used by that request but not persisted anywhere so subsequent calls will reach out to the scm again until the blame is available from indexing or always in case storing blame is completely the retrieved blame should be persisted instead so that subsequent calls don't need to it

summary: performance regression for perforce indexing from to
description: despite some time spent bisecting the fisheye source tree i haven't been able to identify the exact commit that is responsible but i have identified that this issue was first introduced in fisheye the problem the method builds up a list of changesets until the list is larger than the batch size
it then passes them off to the indexbatch method
since the list is not cleared after the batch is indexed and so all changesets that have been indexed so far are to the indexbatch method

this is a problem for svn when creating a review if any of the affected lines are included in the patch because fisheye will see the original file looking something like this but when svn generates the diff it doesn't expand the keyword before generating it will look something like this so if the line containing the id has been modified or is near a line that has been modified fisheye will fail to anchor the patch

summary: fisheye does not allow username returned by authtoken to be different from username entered by user
description: when using a custom authenticator fisheye will query the database for a user with the entered username if none is found it will query the custom authenticator if the custom authenticator returns an authtoken it will create a user in the database based on the username in the authtoken
not the entered username this is a problem if the username returned by the authenticator is different to the username entered
on next login this will happen database will be queried for entered username authenticator will be queried will attempt to create user again but will fail and blow up because user already exists
ideally we should check if the user with the username returned by the authenticator exists before trying to create it again

summary: commit hook events are fired with incorrect changesets for cvs

behaviour observed com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.commitnotificationrepositorylistener line calls getchangesets(commitnotification repositoryhandle engine.getrevisioncache on the first commit that is observed after fisheye has started up no changeset is returned and no event is fired for subsequent commits that are observed the changeset prior to the changeset that was just committed is returned example scenario and outcome fisheye is started from a stopped state a commit is made to the cvs repository fisheye gives this commit the identifier no events are fired in response to this commit another commit is made to the cvs repository fisheye gives this commit the identifier an event is fired for commit further information to come
update second customer reports similar problems this time with a repo
see please check all repo types when addressing this issue update this relates specifically to cvs
testing confirmed this behaviour is not present for either perforce or subversion
rstephens

summary: store perforce branch details
description: at present we do not store the details of perforce branches only their modification times
this means that on startup we need to do branch o on every branch even those which we know changed or which may not even be in the repo we are scanning
to improve the speed of the first scan after startup we should persist the branch details so that only the branch update times and any changed branches need to be retrieved from the repository
note well that the first startup after upgrading to a version of fisheye/crucible containing this bug fix will not be faster than previously as the branches will still need to be loaded
subsequent startups will be faster

summary: emulate behaviour when an user is created by the user synchronisation restore any deleted user with the same username
description: in fisheye and prior when the user synchronisation could not retrieve an user either because of a communication error or because the user was removed in the user would be deleted

later if an user was with the same username the original user was restored along with his admin rights and all his crucible because of this any transient failures or migration between authentication providers would not be visible to the users
an user would automatically be deleted but then restored in any successive synchronisation from any provider ldap crowd etc
if the username matches
changed this behaviour by making the user deletion strict and irreversible
creating an user with the same username as a deleted user does not restore the old user
however this has caused a lot of headaches for the support team as any migration between the authentication providers are now permanent and does not restore the old users after migration
a solution for this is to restore the undocumented behaviour of and prior versions restore any user matching a deleted user with the same username

summary: clearcase no files are indexed for an imported repository using clearfsimport
description: when indexing clearcase repositories fisheye retrieves the vob history using lshistory
when an indexing start date is set in the fisheye configuration that date is used as a since argument to lshistory
when no indexing start date is set fisheye uses the vob creation date
for vobs created with clearfsimport this leads to issues because clearfsimport conserves the creation date of the files that are imported
as a result the mkelem and checkin operations in the clearcase history are dated before the vob creation date and as a result these files are not indexed by fisheye
a workaround until this issue is fixed is to specify an indexing start date that is far in the past

summary: clearcase indexing stops when a branch is defined but never used in a vob
description: there is a bug in the fisheye indexing code for clearcase repositories for branches that have been defined in a vob but have never been used
in the case of a customer there is a branch brancha which has been defined in vob obb but there no versions exist on the branch
in detail fisheye executes cleartool lstype fmt n kind brtype invob vob obb to get list of branches for the vob

one of the branches that is defined in the obb vob is fisheye retrieves the history for branch brancha by executing cleartool lshistory fmt nco all since branch brancha cleartool returns error branch type not found brancha fisheye correctly intercepts the error and ignores the error and returns that there is no information for that branch in the vob
fisheye incorrectly concludes that the vob path was wrong and tries again with the leading slash
cleartool returns an error which caught and indexing stops
the fix is to not retry with a leading slash
the problem could not be reproduced using a linux installation where the vobs are mounted on likely but not verified that this problem only occurs on windows using snapshot views
a workaround is to explicitly exclude the that are causing the problems in the fisheye repository configuration

the consequence is that indexing activity and cpu usage steadily increases during the day drops off at midnight and then increases again
instead we should be using cleartool lshistory since

summary: unicode characters in filenames branch names and tag names replaced by while scanning the repository on windows
description: while scanning a repository fisheye makes calls to the version control system client git or hg and passes filenames branch names and tag names as command line arguments
on windows there is a known bug in the sun jvm that causes unicode characters that are not part of the codepage in command line arguments to be replaced by characters
this typically results in errors like in the sun bug report a workaround is suggested using environment variables instead of command line arguments but that does not seem to work either
this issue does not affect subversion and cvs as fisheye does not use the command line client when scanning the repository
a workaround for this issue is to run fisheye on a different operating system

summary: diff to previous doesn't choose the right parent in git
description: when a branch is merged in git you end up with revisions chronologically interleaved on a branch diff to previous uses the previous revision in time where is should use the parent revision

summary: fisheye watch notifications can potentially not send changesets due to long running incremental slurps
description: fisheye's internals have a timestamp of when its indexes were last indexed and a timestamp of the last time it checked for watches
we would search the internals based on these values which is wrong
instead the date of the last sent changeset should be used as a starting point and search until the last indexed time
this will only fix centralised version control systems and won't fix git and mercurial as someone can have changes committed in the past but not pushed to the repository which is being indexed
the way we handle watches needs to be revisited to handle this case

summary: hg deleted file gets multiple filerevs for every time it is merged

summary: when using the initial import feature an anonymous committer is automatically created which counts against your license
description: i am using a starter license and while trying to get the total committers down to i used the suggested approach of starting from a later revision set a starting point some of the fisheye scm integrations allow you to configure a starting revision from which to start indexing
all commits prior to this starting point are not included in fisheye and do not contribute to the committer count

read more however if you do this and choose to initially import the state of the repository prior to that revision fisheye will create an anonymous user that ends up counting against the committer limit so actually you only get to have committers

i think this is a bit unfair as the whole idea was to skip over commits made by other users yet we get penalized by then only getting committer slots instead of and if you don't choose to do an initial import you lose access to any files within the repository that were never touched by anyone after that revision which should not be part of the restriction as the license currently reads
fyi this is using a subversion repository

summary: hqlquerytranslator needs to review usages of distinct
description: when you search for a and need to apply a disjunctive restriction to attributes it is possible that the same entity will be returned twice in the result set
this is why a select distinct is performed
internally the distinct operation on the database could generally be implemented by using sort on all fields prior to a cull
this process is expensive
since we only need to distinct when we do a join with a custom attributes table we should optimise for the restriction path and not distinct unless custom attributes are involved

summary: add toggle to turn off checking of in validation factors
description: crowd currently uses and in the crowd.token validation factors
this is of course the appropriate default behavior
by binding a cookie.token to the client machine you prevent stolen cookies being useful
however there are some circumstances where you are willing to relax check in order to achieve other goals or to operate within other constraints
examples are large proxying firewalls where requests from the same browser might be served by different proxy ip addresses
this is not uncommon in large corporate environments
you are trying to achieve sso between two apps where one app is behind apache using and the other is using http proxypass
in this environment puts the correct in the validation factors where as proxypass puts the incorrect remote ip but a suitable this makes the validation factors incompatible and makes sso unachievable

this point relates to you have users with mobile devices laptops those funny iphone thingies where moving between wifi access points or moving from work to home means a different ip and an invalid it would be nice to enable remote ip or mobile mode for these users
what i would like to see is a checkbox for disabling use remote ip as a validation factor this would cause crowd to ignore and when looking at validation factors

not sure where this checkbox would go some combination of these globally per directory per application per user or group of users the default behavior of this checkbox should definitely of course be enabled
but i think there is a case where users may want to knowingly disable it in order to achieve sso in their environment

summary: add option to crucible.py for the anchorpath rest parameter
description: add branch option for crucible.py script add branch option for crucible.py the anchorpath attribute in json request like the anchorrepository which would allow user to manually specify the branch to anchor to
a similar option is available when anchoring a patch via ui

reasons to add this option are the following anchoring timeouts when path is not provided crucible has to perform more lookups to match the paths from incoming patch to repository paths to identify the best anchor for the patch
this is operation

if the operation is taking more time the crucible.py fails with an error inaccurate branch selection crucible selects a branch to anchor to based on a number of matching files it picks the branch which has the highest number of paths matching paths from the patch file
in case there are two or more branches matching the same number of paths a branch with the most recent changes is selected
it can happen that a newer branch is not the one from which a patch has been created

summary: crucible upgrade may fail in the middle if db socket timeout too short

in edge cases it may require manual intervention as db upgrade script may not allow to be rerun if partial changes were already applied

summary: duplicated null rows leads to upgrade problems

so next time user tries to start fisheye it would continue upgrade from the next step even though current step is incomplete and because it is incomplete unique index on column would be never set

summary: create an advanced branch selector
description: panel above file tree affects all content below this point both left and right panes the statistics tab will remain there on the left for now and will also be filtered by the branch selector note if fe cannot determine the trunk of a repo the admin system will need to prompt the user to tell it which directory is the trunk when first adding the repo
for customers who are already set up and upgrade but for some reason not picking up trunk we should display a message where the tree is supposed to appear
something like fisheye cannot determine the main branch of your repository
please log into the admin system and select this main branch fe attempts to select a home branch for the branches selector
this will be done by detecting which branch other than trunk the user has last committed to

if the user has never committed to a branch on this repo then the branch selector simply says branch once the user sets their home branch this control will become sticky via a cookie pref the branch selector will be a combined and control the branch selector will need to show some sort of path in case you have more than one branch with the same name in different locations q should we also include tags in this selector or should we move them to within the cog tool menu once a branch is indicated in this selector it will only show the branch name not the path a pencil icon will appear to the right of a branch selector with a branch name in it indicating to the user the selector is editable

clicking on the pencil should clear the selection and activate the control but have an x escape route if the user does not wish to change the branch clicking on the x will return the selection to former state if the branch is currently selected clicking on the branch selector not the pencil will do nothing if the trunk is currently selected clicking on the branch selector not the pencil refreshes the page filtering all views to the selected branch

summary: revision history improvements
description: redesign of the revision list contents
stuff to do with the actual file is in the larger grey section
stuff to do with the whole changeset is in the central white area

this will help to scan the page better since we are now going to be using more than one line for each revision existing links will be placed in a tools cog menu each revision will initially take up a structured lines of screen real estate the commit message should initially be truncated as shown in the mockups expanding the revision using the more twixie will show any extra info plus the entire commit message if it was truncated if there is no extra info and the message has not been truncated the more twixie will say no more and the twixie will be disabled if there is no data then each one of these lines will just be collapsed if there is no content for branch point for tags or properties then all three sections should be hidden
however if there is content for even one of these all should be shown with none if no content for that particular field

eg if the file has properties then those properties will be shown plus branch point for none and tags none each of these extra fields will show a maximum of lines of results then a x more if there is more
this will be a link as shown in the mockup
when clicked the list will be expanded to show all results

summary: error when viewing the commit tab for a user
description: we just upgraded to and none of the project tab commits or users tab commit tab sub links work in crucible

steps to reproduce update jetty to click on projects choose a project the all activity sub link should be active click on commits link get the error the requested resource cannot be found there is nothing in the logs where do get logged here is an example url that is broken we noticed that you can remove the projectkey param to get it to work this only occurs if you update to jetty which we are bound to do in the future
from customer i believe the removal of this else block results in the merging of the parameter from the path and the query string
this was apparently to fix a bug but in the case of fe it causes parameters to be merged and not handled correctly
i believe that the jetty change was correct and this should be considered an fe bug
i suggest that either the rest handling remove duplicate parameters or that the downstream action not tostring the string array when evaluating the resource
the latter is preferable

summary: change mysql table scripts to use engine innodb instead of type innodb
description: change mysql table scripts to use engine innodb instead of type innodb the older type option was synonymous with engine
type has been deprecated since mysql but is still supported for backward compatibility in mysql excepting mysql since mysql it produces a warning
it will be removed in a future mysql release
you should not use type in any new applications and you should immediately begin conversion of existing applications to use engine instead

summary: warn before dropping database in restore
description: in some cases customers may want to create a backup of production and restore on a test server
if they are using an external db in their production server and do not specify a new db when restoring they will drop their production database and recreate this using the backup
this means they will lose the data between the time the backup was restored till the current time not to mention the unknown impact it will have on production server

we should have a big warning during production saying you will delete the database at location blah are you sure you absolutely want to do that please ensure you have a backup of that database if you are not sure
we should provide this warning even if they override their db settings just in case
better yet we should force users to specify a database as it is too easy to override

summary: ao tables are created using the incorrect varchar datatype in sql server
description: when a new confluence database is created on older versions do apply as well the ao tables are created using the varchar datatype even if using the correct dialect for sql server
it is known that confluence must use the nvarchar ntext and nchar datatypes as stated in this kb article however ao active objects tables always used varchar as a pattern

recently in confluence version all ao tables are meant to use nvarchar however if you came from or any older version of confluence the ao tables that were using varchar datatypes are not altered to the correct nvarchar datatype upon upgrading to this is causing many issues with functionalities/plugins that depends on ao tables such as team calendars for example
if a new version of team calendar tries to create a new ao table on it will try to use the nvarchar datatype and if it tries to create a constraint eg
fk between a column using vachar and another using nvarchar the table creation fails hence the plugin/functionality stops working correctly

this screenshoot shows the discrepancy between different ao tables created before and after the upgrade to steps to replicate the bug install a confluence vanilla in or any older version on sql server using the correct dialect in file install an older version of team calendar such as and setup a license for team calendar upgrade confluence to upgrade team calendar to the latest version this will break the team calendar plugin with the following message workaround if you are in or any older version of confluence the team calendars ao tables are created with varchar datatypes instead of nvarchar
to avoid the errors that has been described above steps to replicate the bug section you must then first change the wrongly set datatype to the correct column datatype
unfortunately this must be done manually
you may do so by creating an alteration script and running the script to change the table or follow the exact steps to change the datatypes from this kb article modify each data type manually section
working workaround fix is provided in but customers who want to upgrade to can use steps published onto to get all columns upgraded from varchar to nvarchar
qr notes create confluence compatible test database install confluence on it

install team calendars make sure that there are columns with varchar type shutdown confluence install confluence from branch name old confluence home make sure that upgrade task has run and all ddl queries are logged make sure that no sql errors on confluence or ao upgrades install team calendars make sure that no constraints error in log files make sure that plugin is enabled and all modules except event one are enabled run query above to check that there are no columns with varchar type left

summary: links of jira issues in confluence workbox notification do not get updated when jira base url has changed
description: steps to reproduce install jira and confluence and configure the base url with context path for example to jira confluence create an application link between confluence and jira create a new issue in jira and then comment on the issue with a successful application link integration received notification of the comment in confluence workbox click on the notification and be directed to the issue change jira context url to application link between confluence and jira with the new base url add a new comment on the existing issue in jira with a successful application link integration received notification of the new comment in confluence workbox click on the notification and not be successfully redirected to the issue because it was trying to redirect you to noticed that the context path does not reflect the new context path which is supposed to be clicking on the previous jira issue notification in confluence workbox also will not redirect you to the correct link as it was still pointing to the old base url my assumption was that this url must have been stored somewhere in the database and updating the url manually from the database would work as a workaround

checked on confluence table but jira notifications are not stored in an absolute path but instead like this i then looked into confluence bandana table for application link configuration assuming that confluence take the base url from the configured application link and it appears that the new jira base urls both application url display url are stored correctly in the database where does this url stored or taken from

summary: custom css styles in confluence
description: currently the look and feel of confluence can be customized in three ways themes layouts/decorators colour scheme themes give you the power to customize confluence completely
the same is true for layouts
but with great power comes great responsibility
you will have to know java sitemesh or at least velocity in order to make customizations which is not trivial and a skill most good web designers do not possess
on the other hand customizing the color scheme is fairly easy but limited to a little more then a dozen elements on the page
you can not add additional background images change the size or elements on the page
the stylesheet feature will allow for overwriting all existing styles including styles in themes
that gives you the power to customize your favorite theme without actually modifying any of it's code
the only thing you will need to know is how to write in css
this opens up the styling of confluence to many out there

summary: add support for includefailedtestcoverage to the maven clover plugin
description: i have a util class with a private constructor which simply throws unsupportedoperationexception
i have a test for this class which uses reflection to execute the private constructor this test passes in junit either through the surefire maven plugin or in eclipse
this is due to junit automatically unwrapping an this means that the cause of the invocationtargetexception is matched against the expected instead of invocationtargetexception

my problem is that clover is marking the above test as failed due to clover seeing the invocationtargetexception instead of the unsupportedoperationexception and ignoring the code coverage from that test
if i change the test code to clover will correctly report coverage
in the ant there is a includefailedtestcoverage parameter to the task that specifies whether to include failed test coverage when calculating the total coverage percentage
i can not find a similar parameter for the maven task and i would like to see this feature added

summary: cannot remove all access via svn permission manager
description: if i want to disable read access for all users and remove all groups from the project's entry in the svn permission manager i get the warning granting no access will grant all users read access in fisheye
pardon me granting no access means granting read access to everyone via fisheye okay i technically see why removing all groups in fisheye causes it to use default groups
but users do not care
the behaviour is totally nonsensical and should be fixed
for instance perhaps we could have a nobody group in crowd containing no users and hidden in the group management interface which is always given read access in fisheye

summary: svn permission manager should use svn path configured in fisheye not the project key
description: studio assumes that the subversion directory is equal to the project key
thus the studio jst project maps to the subversion directory

that is a workable assumption for new projects but what do we do when customers have existing subversion repositories that don't conform one option is to use dodgy scripts to rewrite the directory names
this is very often there are references from one directory to another eg
in build systems which renaming would break
directory names are sometimes long and do not map obviously to a jira project key
developers are used to the old names which are more descriptive and generally better than project keys
the better option is leave subversion alone and for atlassian to manually reconfigure fisheye to parse the original directory names
the only thing stopping this from being an option is the svn permission manager
it generates a svn authz file using the project key regardless of how fisheye is configured
so i'd like to suggest that the svn permission manager be modified to query fisheye to find the actual configured path and then use that in the authz file

summary: the createsettingsforkey method in the jirapluginsettingsfactory
description: currently the jirapluginsettingsfactory is implemented quite badly as creating a new propertyset relies entirely on the key being passed in to be a valid project key
this is unnecessary as propertysets can be created with any string as a key
it in fact breask dashboards as dashboards tries to create a propertyset with an arbitrary string key and the jirapluginsettinsfactory throws an exception since not a valid project key
jira already provides a propertysetfactory that sal should be using
so the code should change from to this commit this fix on this will break backwards compatibility however and existing studio data will have to be migrated
once this makes it into studio need an upgrade task to loop over all the projects get their propertysets create new property sets and copy all the pairs across

summary: agent upload of artifacts fails to set in on lighthttpd or nginx
description: bamboo agent upload of artifacts fails to set causes problems when using a proxy that implements strict our preferred reverse proxy solution is lighttpd
however use of lighttpd resulted in failure of bamboo agents to upload artifacts to the bamboo server

upon investigation we discovered the following error in the lighttpd error logs but missing section for compatibility with applications requests containing a must include a valid header field unless the server is known to be compliant

if a request contains a and a is not given the server should respond with bad request if it cannot determine the length of the message or with length required if it wishes to insist on receiving a valid and below in section length required the server refuses to accept the request without a defined content length
the client may repeat the request if it adds a valid header field containing the length of the in the request message

and further below in section the field indicates the size of the in decimal number of octets sent to the recipient or in the case of the head method the size of the that would have been sent had the request been a get
an example is applications should use this field to indicate the transfer-length of the unless this is prohibited by the rules in section any greater than or equal to zero is a valid value
section describes how to determine the length of a if a is not given

note that the meaning of this field is significantly different from the corresponding definition in mime where it is an optional field used within the in http it should be sent whenever the length can be determined prior to being transferred unless this is prohibited by the rules in section according to my research both microsoft iis and lighttpd are strict on this
i have confirmed that lighttpd does not have a configuration option to disable this level of strictness
apache however is lax about enforcing this rule

summary: resolve perforce source directory issue
description: we changed perforce to set the source code directory to the plans folder as opposed to using the root defined in perforce
the reasons for this change are the reason the changes were made initially was to make it easier for you to run distributed builds
the benefit of this is that a single plan can be run on different remote agents and different machines using the one client file
you don't have to worry about ensuring that the workspace root exists exactly the same on all of these boxes bamboo will look after it all for you

it also mean that the build data is stored in your bamboo home rather than elsewhere on the system where there may be permissioning there were also some issues with caching the source repository that we were trying to resolve
the problem is that there now needs to be one client per plan in case they build at the same time and alter the dir
some customers have expressed that this is not a good idea

see alternatives switch it back to the way it was just using perforce's definition provide a toggle the user can pick the old way or the new way concerns the caching source dir is not necessarily needed at this point in time as the build process has changed what are the consequences if it ever fails to get the client root can only set alternate roots this functionality hasn't been tested yet either if there is the option the user will have to ensure that he doesn't have client set to manage on one plan and not manage on another

any help in this matter would be greatly appreciated

summary: parsing of system environment variables field is broken
description: the system environment variables takes a space-separated list of environment variables
this is insufficient as variables like cppflags and ldflags often need to be set to values that themselves contain spaces
bamboo attempts to support this with some of quoted strings but the logic is broken
it avoids splitting on spaces between quotes any quotes at all not matching ones
so if i configure this value then what actually ends up in my build environment is the very malformed the variable cppflags actually contains the string ldflags in its value
related to this issue is the problem that once you are configuring several environment variables the edit box quickly becomes unwieldy
both these problems could be fixed by making the environment variables configuration a textarea and splitting on newlines

summary: dependencies should pass down meta data about the dependency chain

we could even add some extra tool to show this graphically would be available to the underlying build process where it could be used to retrieve artifacts or extra information about the originating build
